reference.shortdesc: A subscript is a letter, number, or figure that is printed lower than the line. It is frequently used in chemical and mathematical formulas.

section.title: Formatting expectations
section.p: Although rendering is left up to implementations, processors typically apply render the contents of the sub element in subscript highlighting or placed lower in relationship to the surrounding text. Subscripted text also is often a smaller font than the surrounding text.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The sub element is specialized from ph.

example.title: Example
example.codeblock: The power produced by the electrohydraulic dam was 1010 more than the older electric plant. The difference was H2O.
